intro: Senecio werneriifolius var. incertus, commonly known as the uncertain werneriifolius senecio, is a rare and lesser-known variant within the Senecio genus. It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring elongated, serrated leaves that are often a vibrant green. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, typical of many Senecio species. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky, arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
